Subjective: Headaches ~2 months, worsening. Primarily right-sided, sometimes diffuse. Mild nausea at worst, no vomiting. Glare in vision, no flashes. Photophobia, prefers dark room. Aggravated by talking. Lasts few days, subsides. Initially infrequent, now at least weekly. Family hx migraines/cluster headaches. Student (medicine). No coffee/energy drinks. No significant stress. No tumors. Impact on daily life: unable to play volleyball, couldn't join friends drinking beer. Prefers dark room, worse with talking.
Objective: BP 120/80. Pulse 50 bpm, steady. Cranial nerves intact. Fingertip-nose test normal. Arm/leg strength normal. Romberg's normal. Gait slightly unsteady but manageable. No other neurological deficits noted.
Assessment: Headache, likely migraine. Differential diagnosis includes cluster headache, tension-type headache. No red flags for secondary causes like tumor.
Plan: Patient education: Migraine information on thuisarts.nl.
Medication: Start paracetamol 4x2 tabs at fixed times as soon as symptoms start. If insufficient, add ibuprofen.
Lifestyle: Keep headache diary (printout provided) to track symptoms, triggers, and severity.
Follow-up: Return in 4 weeks with diary for review. Return sooner if symptoms worsen significantly or change.
Safety netting: Return sooner if symptoms worsen significantly or change.
